reactjs.description: A simple calculator that binds the physical keyboard with the GUI, allowing type/click/push input. It's made with ReactJS and it also features key sounds.
App that fetches random quotes and display it to the user, made with ReactJS and react-transition-group for the main transition.
Simple app made with ReactJS that automatically identifies the units of temperature the user types in, and converts the amount to other units.
A simple app made with ReactJS that previews markdown input.

frontEnd.description: A FreeCodeCamp Responsive Web Design Project for a coffee shop. Here I used a polyfill for smooth scrolling, rather than coding it manually as I did in my previous project.
A responsive project for a technical documentation page. I specially loved learning how to use the :before and :after pseudo-elements to design and implement tricky styles.
This was my first big project. It's an app that allows to draw weird shapes everytime the user clicks over the white canvas. It allows shapes customization and language selection.
I improved the bouncing balls game that was developed at MDN course site, allowing multiplayer and diagonal moves. Use arrow and A/W/S/D keys to play the game. Only for Desktop.

python.description: I developed and deployed a server app that manages books, authors and loaning for a local library with user/admin login integration.
I ventured with a project called MBac on Open Science about image recognition on bacteria samples. I learned OpenCV for a month from scratch and coded a script on python for our needs.

misc.description: Born from a forum user request. I designed, developed and maintained my first browser extension, that allows the user to filter and manage tabs either manually or automatically.
